text:
Home > Hotels & Resorts > 5 Best Hotels in Edinburgh Scotland To Enjoy Your Stay 5 Best Hotels in Edinburgh Scotland To Enjoy Your Stay By admin on August 12, 2015 Pin It 
Some of the best hotels in Edinburgh Scotland are the ones that serve as places ideal for couples, kids and families featuring the exotic sights of Edinburgh Castle. 
Most hotels in Edinburgh Scotland offer Michelin-starred dining and they possess a cosy character, friendly service and period charm. 
There are different types of hotels in Edinburgh starting from the ones with fashionable bling to the ones providing theatrical extravagance with stylish and flamboyant rooms. Best Hotels in Edinburgh Scotland 
Here are the best hotels in Edinburgh Scotland, where you can enjoy stay during your visit. The Balmoral Hotel 
This is one of the most prestigious hotels in Edinburgh Scotland. The hotel features a majestic clock which defines the skyline of the city and it runs three minutes fast since its inception in the year 1902. It is a grand hotel which is also one of the most priced possessions of Edinburgh. 
For more information: The Balmoral Hotel The Edinburgh Residence 
The Edinburgh Residence is a five star hotel offering an experience that always remains in the memory of its visitors. The hotel boasts of an illustrious collection of a total of twenty-nine luxury suites in combination with incomparable luxury and space for leisure as well as business travelers. 
For more information: The Edinburgh Residence G&V Royal Mile Hotel 
The G&V Royal Mile Hotel was formerly called Hotel Missoni Edinburgh. It is a contemporary and a stunning landmark which is located centrally in this Scottish capital. It is a hotel that you can head towards if you are looking for comfort, style, heritage and exclusiveness. 
For further information: G&V Royal Mile Hotel Prestonfield House 
This is a luxury hotel set in Newington and it features a rooftop terrace and 4 lounges or bars along with free Wi Fi, valet parking, full breakfast and 24 hours room service. Concierge services are also available at this hotel. 
For further details: Prestonfield House The Pavilion at Lamb’s House 
It is a self-catering hotel which is also a part of National Trust and it provides a stunning 17th century façade. The décor of this hotel is quite warm and the interiors are well-equipped. There is a small garden and elegant sitting rooms for the visitors.
